step1.sentence: After months of careful planning, the team was finally ready to launch a project that could reshape the entire industry.

step2.story: Maya had been pitching her idea to investors for over a year with no luck. Then one morning, a venture capital firm called and said yes. Within a week, she assembled her team and officially launched a project that would change the way small businesses manage their finances.

step3.story: Daniel stared at the whiteboard covered in diagrams and sticky notes. His startup had burned through two failed prototypes, and the pressure from investors was mounting. But this time felt different — the engineering team had cracked the core algorithm, and the beta testers were sending glowing feedback. On a rainy Tuesday morning, Daniel gathered everyone in the conference room and announced they would officially launch a project called "Greenline," an app designed to help city residents reduce their carbon footprint. The room erupted in applause. After eighteen months of doubt and late nights, the dream was finally becoming real.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 'launch'는 원래 배를 물에 띄우거나 로켓을 발사한다는 뜻이고, 'a project'는 프로젝트를 의미하므로 '프로젝트를 발사하다/출범시키다'라는 직역이 됩니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 새로운 프로젝트나 사업, 캠페인 등을 공식적으로 시작할 때 사용합니다. 단순히 '시작하다(start)'보다 더 큰 규모의, 준비 과정을 거친 공식적인 출범을 나타냅니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'Launch'는 고대 프랑스어 'lanchier(던지다, 발사하다)'에서 유래했으며, 원래 창을 던지거나 배를 진수시키는 물리적 행위를 뜻했습니다. 이후 의미가 확장되어 새로운 일을 공식적으로 시작하는 비유적 표현으로 쓰이게 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 'Launch a project'는 단순한 시작이 아니라 충분한 준비 끝에 공식적으로 세상에 내놓는 느낌입니다. 비즈니스, 기술, 학술 분야에서 자주 쓰이며, 약간의 격식과 진지함이 담긴 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We plan to launch a project next quarter to improve customer experience.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 우리는 고객 경험을 개선하기 위해 다음 분기에 프로젝트를 시작할 계획입니다.
